title: New Bedford Whaling National Historical Park: Park Home
body: The City That Lit the World  "The town itself is perhaps the dearest place to live in, in all New England..nowhere in all America will you find more patrician-like houses, parks and gardens more opulent, than in New Bedfordâ€¦all these brave houses and flowery gardens came from the Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian oceans. One and all, they were harpooned and dragged up hither from the bottom of the sea."H. Melville, "Moby-Dick"                Free Yoga in the Garden   Have you ever wanted to try yoga? If so, now is the opportunity to try it for free at a national park. Saturday mornings at 9:00 to 10:00 AM        Thursday Concerts in the Park   Variety of free events including musical performances in a beautiful garden setting. Limited seating is available and the public is invited               Guided Walking Tours   Free Guided Walking Tours offered daily at 10:30 AM and 2:30 PM, stop by the National Park Visitor Center to start your tour!        Things To Do   The national park visitor center offers a variety of the things to do within the park.
